NODE_TEXT:
Rename the PC station. The name of the PC station must match the station name in the Station Configuration Editor in which the computer name is preset. We recommend using the Windows computer name of the ES (for example, "ES22"). This applies to all PC stations. A yellow arrow then appears on the ES PC station icon in the SIMATIC Manager to indicate the capability of the ES to establish a connection to the plant bus via the "PC internal" interface.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# Creating and managing a PCS 7 project

# 5.5 Adding Additional Stations

1. Select the "Computer name identical to PC station name" option in the PC station object properties. The "Computer name" field cannot be empty as other functions such as "Configure PC Station" need to be able to access this name.
2. Note: When asset management is used, no computer name is entered for the PC station of the ES (yellow arrow). Detailed information is available in the section "Integrated Asset Management (Page 310)".

Open the PC station in HW Config.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# Creating and managing a PCS 7 project

# 5.5 Adding Additional Stations

1. Insert a CP16x3 for communication with the plant bus. Optionally, when "WinCC Application" is added, you can test OS Runtime on the ES with the "OS Simulation" function.
2. Create a new subnet for your plant bus in the object properties of the CP16x3 and assign the planned MAC address to the CP16x3. Change the name of this e.g.
Q: What is the recommended name for the PC station according to the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: The recommended name for the PC station is the Windows computer name of the ES, for example, 'ES22'.
A2: It is advised to use the ES's Windows computer name, such as 'ES22', as the PC station name.
A3: According to the guidelines, the PC station should be named after the ES's Windows computer name, e.g., 'ES22'.
A4: The name of the PC station must match the ES's Windows computer name, like 'ES22', as per the configuration manual.
A5: For naming the PC station, follow the recommendation to use the Windows computer name of the ES, exemplified by 'ES22'.

A1: When asset management is used, no computer name is entered for the PC station of the ES.

A3: No computer name is needed for the ES's PC station if asset management is being utilized.

Q: What is the significance of the 'Configure PC Station' function requiring the 'Computer name' field not to be empty?
A1: The 'Configure PC Station' function needs the 'Computer name' field to be filled to access the name for configuration purposes.
A2: An empty 'Computer name' field would prevent the 'Configure PC Station' function from accessing necessary details.
A3: The function relies on the 'Computer name' field being populated to perform its configuration tasks.
A4: For 'Configure PC Station' to work, the 'Computer name' field must contain a value to proceed with configurations.
A5: The requirement ensures that 'Configure PC Station' has the necessary information to execute its functions.
